title: First Nasus, now Shyvana and Garen
body:
I really like those smaller pseudo-rework changes Riot is giving champions in a wonky spot.

It's certainly a way better approach to balance rather than just add or detract power.

Hats off to you Riot, this is exactly what I like to see.

Anxious to see who's next, this is way more interesting than the Assassin reworks in my opinion^^

replies.body: Honestly, I'm not thrilled about her passive. Passives that rely on a map, rather than the champion, are uninteresting.
Wait, what happens to Shyvana on ARAM and Twisted Treeline? She just doesn't get a passive?
I am betting on those maps she will just gain random dragons after every so often or at every tower kill/ major objective monster?

I seriously doubt that. Ivern doesn't have a passive on ARAM, skarner doesn't have a passive on ARAM, so they probably won't give her one. Even though besides ivern she is probably the worst champ in ARAM.
Skarner does have a passive on aram. 5 of em.
Also, Azir has no passive on Dominion.

No one has a passive on Dominion.

Rest in peace.
If they go through with the new passive idea, a separate passive will be made for different maps.

~~Why so sure? Ivern doesn't have separate passive.~~
EDIT: Now I see Superb's post that Riot said they intend to. Well, that's a bummer there are champions who won't get such treatment, too, then.
If they decide to go through with this passive, Riot made a statement that they intend to compensate her somehow.
I have mixed feeling about this honestly, on one hand you are right on the other hand it is kinda shyvannas job to secure dragons as a jungler so it kind of is part of her kit in that way.
By that same argument, it could be said securing dragon is part of every jungler's kit. In addition, it means Shyvana has no passive until her, or her team, kill a dragon.
True, but to be fair, her old passive is super ultra mega boring. It's literally "Here are free stats".

As a Kindred/Shyvana player.. I agree.

With kindred I hate how my early game strategy often hangs on if RNG decides to send my first mark to enemy raptors at 2:30 or not.

We're feeling pretty good about them so far, too. We'll be communicating more about this approach in the near future.

Garen isn't going to ship in 6.23 - more work to be done before that changelist is ready, and not enough time to get it into the 6.23 patch. It'll be off the PBE soon, likely to come back in some form during the 6.24 cycle.
Are the rek'sai changes  looking like they might come in 6.24-7.1?

Oh then by mid january-ish? Daz kewl :D
You have a surprisingly specific definition of "early next year." I wouldn't count on mid January. Some point before April is a more realistic hope in my opinion.

Well the Garen changes did look incomplete compared to Shyvana's anyways^^
Glad you're putting so much effort in giving champions that have fallen out of flavor some love.^^

Are there any more champions you've got your eye on or is that too early to say anyways. Because I really like this approach, it's not only interesting but the changes usually really help bring older kits up to date.

Garen's not likely to get a large set of changes - probably just one mechanic and maybe a little numbers tweaking. Shyvana's scope isn't going to be any kind of standard, she received more changes than will be typical.

As for who else - not sure. We chose Shyvana and Garen because they were champions we needed to work on for balance reasons anyway.

And, just so we're clear, sometimes a balance change will be just a balance change. This is something experimental we're trying; we think it's promising, but I don't want to hard commit to doing lots more before we've had a chance to assess our results.

Would you consider reverting his move speed nerfs (the base movespeed nerf and the % movespeed bonus on his q).

When I think of Garen I think of a guy who can charge his way through a battlefield and cut through his foes as he does it. Right now it doesn't feel that way seeing as how he gets stopped in his tracks at the slightest cc.

Would you also consider giving him back his tenacity reduction? I feel like it was a big part of his kit/playstyle. He literally yells: "Break their ranks!" when he activates e, but right now he isn't doing much breaching. More like scratching at the surface of a beefy frontline  while getting destroyed by the backline.

Even if you don't decided to do anything else, I am very thankful for the current changes that you have set in stone. Much appreciated!

What about Skarner? not trying to be a dick, repertoir wrote that he wanted to make him less dependant on his crystals some months ago, but since then...nothing. Should i expect those changes to be scrapped till the vgu? thanks for your time =)

{{champion:106}}  R falls off ridiculously hard and once bite is used you really feel like you're threat level significantly diminished.He really just need "something to do" while he waits for his more important CD's.

Regarding that, how about you think about Aatrox and bringing him in line with other skirmishers? Yi has the "can't be slowed", Trynda is unkillable, Fiora has Riposte and the AoE heal.
Aatrox should get something like an Olaf ult as well - but that instead of just deleting CC, converts it into DoT that he has to lifesteal in order to survive.
Or make him the anti-knockup diver. Any time he gets knocked into the air, his Q comes off cooldown and can be cast while in the air.

Hi Axes! Avid Garen player here. I like the changes to his E. Garen has always been lacking some strength in his juggernaut personality. His health and HP per level are very low relative to other juggernauts and he doesn't have great early damage. The new change helps one aspect but his health is gated by his passive, W active and passive. Not only can you cap out the W passive in less than 20 minutes, but he also has so little health for his W active and passive to be very impactful most of the game. Changes to his health and W would be the best things to consider as well. Maybe even add some slow resistance to his Q speed up. Thank you for all you do!
